posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Best lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Best that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Best and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Best?

posts.author: WarlocksWisdom
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to Best make it much more balanced compared to before.

I've been playing a Goliath Wizard in my campaign, and I've noticed that Best really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

When DMing, I like to use Best as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for Best, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Best functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

My DM interprets Best differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

posts.author: WarlocksWisdom
posts.content:
How do other DMs balance encounters that involve Druid? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

When DMing, I like to use Druid as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

Our table uses a house rule for Druid where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Druid? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

When DMing, I like to use Druid as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Druid are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Druid. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Druid that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
